channel.title: National
channel.description: The Washington Post's national news coverage. Get the latest national news, featuring national security, science and the courts. Read breaking national news headlines from across the U.S.

item.title: Trump calls for troops in Portland, escalating use of military inside U.S.
item.dc:creator: Michael Birnbaum, Dan Lamothe, Todd Frankel
item.description: President Donald Trump authorized the use of troops in Portland, Oregon, in a campaign to use the U.S. military against Americans that has little modern precedent.

item.title: DNA testing links dead man to Texas yogurt shop killings, police say
item.dc:creator: Vivian Ho
item.description: Robert Eugene Brashers has been named by police as a suspect in the 1991 killings of four teenage girls in Austin -- the subject of “The Yogurt Shop Murders” miniseries.

item.title: A year before the Little Rock Nine, Bobby Cain helped integrate Southern schools
item.dc:creator: Emmanuel Felton
item.description: Mr. Cain, who has died at 85, was part of the Clinton 12, who integrated an all-White Tennessee high school in 1956. Two years later, the school was bombed.

item.title: Dominion and former Trump lawyer Rudy Giuliani settle defamation lawsuit
item.dc:creator: Brianna Tucker, Andrew Jeong
item.description: Lawyers for Dominion Voting Systems and Giuliani said they agreed to a “confidential settlement” of the case, with dollar terms undisclosed.

item.title: Jimmy Kimmel is coming back to Nexstar and Sinclair’s ABC stations
item.dc:creator: Scott Nover, Shannon Najmabadi
item.description: “Jimmy Kimmel Live!” has been off the air on ABC stations in D.C. and other markets since Disney-owned ABC reinstated the late-night host Tuesday.

item.title: Assata Shakur, Black Power militant who fled to Cuba, dies at 78
item.dc:creator: Emmanuel Felton, Anumita Kaur
item.description: Convicted of murdering a New Jersey state trooper, she escaped prison and fled the country. She called herself “a 20th-century escaped slave.”

item.title: Hurricane Humberto tracker: Map and projected storm path
item.dc:creator: Dylan Moriarty, Szu Yu Chen, N. Kirkpatrick
item.description: Humberto is the 8th named storm of the hurricane season.

item.title: A school in Kentucky banned phones. Remarkable things started happening.
item.dc:creator: Maggie Penman
item.description: After Ballard High School banned phones, they saw a 67% increase in students checking out library books.

item.title: This blue state governor sent the National Guard to her biggest city
item.dc:creator: Karin Brulliard
item.description: New Mexico Gov. Michelle Lujan Grisham sent soldiers to Albuquerque to help police deal with crime, making sure it didn’t look like a military takeover.

item.title: Love pours in for a dying octopus as she tends to eggs that will never hatch
item.dc:creator: Angie Orellana Hernandez
item.description: Fans and caretakers have expressed an outpouring of grief and love for Ghost, a strikingly beautiful giant Pacific octopus, as she nears the end of her life.

item.title: Families of Camp Mystic victims say plan to reopen ‘intensified our grief’
item.dc:creator: Kim Bellware, Gaya Gupta
item.description: CiCi and Will Steward, whose 8-year-old daughter is still missing, sent a letter criticizing the plan to reopen and build an on-site memorial honoring flood victims.

item.title: Dallas shooter intended to harm ICE agents, officials say
item.dc:creator: Molly Hennessy-Fiske, Anumita Kaur, Angie Orellana Hernandez, Victoria Craw, Niha Masih
item.description: The gunman left notes indicating he acted alone and did not want to hurt detainees, authorities said. The shooting killed one detainee and critically injured two others.
